Kemendagri: Revisi PP Perangkat Daerah Agar APIP Lebih Independen
04 Nov 2019, 00:31 by Ibnu Hariyanto
Jakarta - Kemendagri mengeluarkan Peraturan Pemerintah (PP) Nomor 72 Tahun 2019 tentang Perubahan atas Peraturan Pemerintah Nomor 18 Tahun 2016 tentang Perangkat Daerah. PP tersebut sebagai bagian dari upaya penguatan Aparat Pengawasan Intern Pemerintah (APIP) yang ada di pemerintah daerah agar lebih independen.
"Dikeluarkannya PP Nomor 72 Tahun 2019 ini adalah bagian dari penguatan APIP di daerah. Ini semua semangatnya adalah menguatkan APIP Daerah agar lebih independen," kata Kepala Pusat Penerangan Kemendagri Bahtiar dalam keterangannya, Minggu (3/11/2019).
Bahtiar mengatakan penguatan APIP itu dilakukan sesuai rekomendasi KPK kepada Presiden. Rekomendasi KPK agar APIP dapat lebih independen, efektif dan optimal dalam mengawasi perangkat daerah.
Bahtiar menjelaskan setidaknya ada enam substansi perubahan untuk APIP Daerah. Pertama, soal penambahan fungsi Inspektorat Daerah untuk mencegah korupsi dan pengawasan reformasi birokrasi. Menurutnya, hal ini diharapkan bisa mengurangi jumlah pejabat daerah yang terjerat oleh KPK
"Harapannya APIP dapat membangun FCP atau Fraud Control Plan guna meminimalisir korupsi khususnya Operasi Tangkap Tangan (OTT)," kata Bahtiar.
Kedua, mengenai penambahan kewenangan bagi APIP dapat melakukan pengawasan berindikasi kerugian daerah tanpa harus menunggu persetujuan Kepala Daerah. Lalu ketiga, soal pola pelaporan disampaikan berjenjang.
"Harapannya Laporan Hasil Pemeriksaan (LHP) APIP daerah tidak berhenti di LHP, tapi ada supervisi dari Mendagri untuk provinsi dan gubernur sebagai wakil pemerintah pusat di daerah untuk kabupaten/kota," lanjutnya.

Ministry of Home Affairs: Revision of PP on Regional Apparatuses to Make APIP More Independent
04 Nov 2019, 00:31 by Ibnu Hariyanto
Jakarta - The Ministry of Home Affairs issued Government Regulation (PP) Number 72 of 2019 concerning Amendments to Government Regulation Number 18 of 2016 concerning Regional Apparatuses. The PP is part of an effort to strengthen the Government Internal Oversight Apparatus (APIP) in local governments to be more independent.
"The issuance of PP No. 72 of 2019 is part of the strengthening of APIP in the regions. All this enthusiasm is to strengthen the Regional APIP to be more independent," said the Head of Information Center of the Ministry of Home Affairs Bahtiar in his statement on Sunday (3/11/2019).
Bahtiar said the strengthening of the APIP was carried out in accordance with the KPK's recommendations to the President. KPK's recommendation is that APIP be more independent, effective and optimal in overseeing regional apparatuses.
Bahtiar explained that there were at least six amendments to the Regional APIP. First, about the addition of the function of the Regional Inspectorate to prevent corruption and oversee bureaucratic reform. According to him, this is expected to reduce the number of regional officials who are ensnared by the KPK
"Hopefully, APIP can build an FCP or Fraud Control Plan to minimize corruption, especially Operation Catching Hands (OTT)," Bahtiar said.
Second, regarding the addition of authority for APIP, it can carry out supervision indicating regional losses without having to wait for the approval of the Regional Head. Then third, the matter of reporting patterns was submitted tiered.
"It is hoped that the Regional APIP Examination Report (LHP) does not stop at the LHP, but there is supervision from the Minister of Home Affairs for the province and the governor as the representative of the central government in the region for the district / city," he continued.
